author.orgname: Office of Informatics and Information Governance (OIIG)

row.entry: Professor, Cardiovascular Medicine, University of Utah School of Medicine; Staff Cardiologist, Salt Lake City VA Medical Center
Assistant Professor, Cardiovascular Medicine, University of Utah; School of Medicine Staff Cardiologist, Salt Lake City VAMC
Professor of Medicine, Wayne State University; Section Chief, Cardiology, John Dingell VAMC
Adult outpatient needing Cardiology consult for arrhythmia evaluation
Clinical Providers in Primary Care Clinic
Ensure a minimum workup is initiated prior to a Cardiology Consultation for adult patients who present to a Primary Care Clinic for evaluation of atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter

chapter.title: External Data Definitions
chapter.para: No externalData expression definitions and no trigger definitions are present.

row.entry: Codes: elm:element[elm:Code]: [447113005 |12 lead electrocardiogram at rest (procedure)|]
Annotation: Resting 12-lead electrocardiogram to evaluate for arrhythmia
Consider other consult modalities which may be available (e.g., e-consult or other rapidly iterative consult method. A simple consult is included here as the overarching clinical intent.
◎ Referral to cardiology to evaluate atrial fibrillation/atrial flutter
topic: Precoordinated Expression 183519002 |Referral to cardiology service (procedure)|
purpose[0]: Postcoordinated Expression [386053000 |Evaluation procedure (procedure)] ->(363702006 |Has focus (attribute))->[195080001 |Atrial fibrillation and flutter (disorder)]
Specific goal of the cardiology consultation (e.g., cardiology to manage patient, cardiology to risk stratify and recommend management, etc.)
Consider ordering prior to the cardiology consultation. Resting 12-lead electrocardiogram is required if it has not been obtained within the past 2 months.
❂ Resting 12-lead electrocardiogram to evaluate for arrhythmia now
topic: Precoordinated Expression 447113005 |12 lead electrocardiogram at rest (procedure)|
purpose[0]: Postcoordinated Expression [386053000 |Evaluation procedure (procedure)] ->(363702006 |Has focus (attribute))->[698247007 |Cardiac arrhythmia (disorder)]
❂ Echocardiogram to evaluate for left ventricular function now
purpose[0]: Postcoordinated Expression [386053000 |Evaluation procedure (procedure)] ->(363702006 |Has focus (attribute))->[366188009 |Finding of left ventricular function (finding)]
❂ X-ray chest to evaluate for heart failure now
purpose[0]: Postcoordinated Expression [386053000 |Evaluation procedure (procedure)] ->(363702006 |Has focus (attribute))->[84114007 |Heart failure (disorder)]
Consider the following tests to be completed prior to the cardiology consultation
topic: Precoordinated Expression bd01faa8-443c-4ad6-9cb6-ea50b4d7a093 |Basic metabolic profile (procedure)
topic: Precoordinated Expression 390917008 |Brain natriuretic peptide measurement (procedure)|

chapter.title: Medications
chapter.para: Based upon clinical judgement, consider initiating a new order for one or more of the following medications prior to the cardiology consultation, if not otherwise contraindicated.

row.entry: ✪ Metoprolol tartrate 50 mg tablet oral daily 2 times 60 tablets 2 refills

topic: Postcoordinated Expression [416118004 |Administration (procedure)] ->(260686004 |Method (attribute))->[129445006 |Administration - action (qualifier value)] ->(363701004 |Direct substance (attribute))->[Rx;866514 Metoprolol Tartrate 50 MG Oral Tablet] ->(410675002 |Route of administration (attribute))->[260548002 |Oral (qualifier value)]

If the CHA2DS2-VASc score was less than 2, then display the list of antiplatelet medications.
✪ Aspirin 81 mg tablet oral daily 1 time 30 tablets 2 refills

✪ Clopidogrel 75 mg tablet oral daily 1 time 30 tablets 2 refills

topic: Postcoordinated Expression [416118004 |Administration (procedure)] ->(260686004 |Method (attribute))->[129445006 |Administration - action (qualifier value)] ->(363701004 |Direct substance (attribute))->[Rx;309362 clopidogrel 75 MG Oral Tablet] ->(410675002 |Route of administration (attribute))->[260548002 |Oral (qualifier value)]
If the CHA2DS2-VASc score was greater than or equal to 2, then display the list of anticoagulants. For patients with a CHA2DS2-VASc score of 2 or greater, consider initiating anticoagulation therapy.
✪ Apixaban 5 mg tablet oral daily 2 times 60 tablets 2 refills

A group of related alternative actions is a sentence group if the item referenced by the action is the same in all the actions, and each action simply constitutes a different variation on how to specify the details for that item. For example, two actions that could be in a SentenceGroup are "aspirin, 500 mg, 2 times per day" and "aspirin, 300 mg, 3 times per day". In both cases, aspirin is the item referenced by the action, and the two actions represent two different options for how aspirin might be ordered for the patient. Note that a SentenceGroup would almost always have an associated selection behavior of "AtMostOne", unless it's a required action, in which case, it would be "ExactlyOne".
A group with this behavior logically groups its sub-elements, and may be shown as a visual group to the end user, but it is not required to do so.
Any group marked with this behavior should be displayed as a visual group to the end user.
Any number of the items in the group may be chosen, from zero to all.
All the items in the group must be selected as a single unit.
All the items in the group are meant to be chosen as a single unit: either all must be selected by the end user, or none may be selected.
The end user must choose one and only one of the selectable items in the group. The user may not choose none of the items in the group.
The end user may choose zero or at most one of the items in the group.
The end user must choose a minimum of one, and as many additional as desired.
An action with this behavior must be included in the actions processed by the end user; the end user may not choose not to include this action.
An action with this behavior may be included in the set of actions processed by the end user.
An action with this behavior must be included in the set of actions processed by the end user, unless the end user provides documentation as to why the action was not included.

An action with this behavior is one of the most frequent actions that is, or should be, included by an end user, for the particular context in which the action occurs. The system displaying the action to the end user should consider "pre-checking" such an action as a convenience for the user.

An action with this behavior is one of the less frequent actions included by the end user, for the particular context in which the action occurs. The system displaying the actions to the end user would typically not "pre-check" such an action.
An action with this behavior may only be completed once.
An action with this behavior may be repeated multiple times.
This item, in a list entry, allows the user to enter a fill in value that is not present in the set of presented choices.
For a particular action or action group, specifies whether the elements are read only.
